discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Mac operating systems" from admin guide pg. 85

Selected Answer: D
Dylib Hijacking

Prevents Dylib-hijacking attacks where the attacker attempts to load dynamic libraries on Mac operating systems from unsecured locations to gain control of a process.

questions.question_text: An attacker tries to load dynamic libraries on macOS from an unsecure location. Which Cortex XDR module can prevent this attack?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
EPM targets and blocks a particular exploit type like:
Heap Spray (Defense: Memory Limit Heap Spray Check)
JIT Spray (Defense: JIT Mitigation)
ROP (Defense: ROP Mitigation)
Using OS Function (Defense: DLL Security)
DEP Circumvention (Defense: UASLR)

Selected Answer: B
DLL security is part of the EPM

questions.question_text: Which Exploit Protection Module (EPM) can be used to prevent attacks based on OS function?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
B and C are discarded automatically: not all the agents have full disk encryption and there are 3,297 CVEs but they are not incidents.
A is discarded due to that graph is not forensic related, this is most likely inventory data so the answer is D"
